oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Ricky Skaggs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Ricky Skaggs (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Recording is from May 09, 1984.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Ricky Skaggs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery introduces Ricky Skaggs and "How High the Moon" -- (01:22) Skaggs reflects on the time the Whites were working with Emmylou Harris -- (02:23) Skaggs and Emery joke about copying Les Paul -- (03:11) Emery invites Skaggs to reflect on his high school career -- (05:25) Emery compliments Skaggs' band and both recall doing a kidney foundation show -- (08:55) Emery discusses Lee Greenwood and "Fools Gold" among other tracks -- (10:41) Emery expresses his love for instrumentalists and Skaggs reveals the results of a poll about himself -- (13:19) Skaggs and Emery reflect on the Skaggs family name and his enjoyment from studying history -- (17:26) Emery and Skaggs perform their sign off -- (17:57) Skaggs and Emery greet each other to start the next show -- (18:58) Skaggs and Emery joke about Skaggs' contribution and Bill Monroe -- (21:14) Emery and Skaggs discuss what Skaggs likes to do for fun -- (23:58) "You May See Me Walking" and Skaggs first number one record is reflected on -- (25:32) Emery and Skaggs discuss Skaggs' 'most terrifying' performances -- (31:45) Skaggs imitates Jerry Lee Louis -- (32:02) Emery asks Skaggs what he enjoys, how much he ways, his height, his birthday and other questions -- (33:55) Skaggs' beeper is mentioned -- (35:11) Emery and Skaggs perform their sign-offs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Skaggs, Ricky;
